poem:
Delabole's Dance  

On the Cornish winds,  
ten giants turn,  
weaving whispers  
into kinetic dawns.  
Old Peter's hand—  
steady as earth's pulse—  
sewed fields of breath.  
Millennial wild,  
they hum a hymn  
that lights the hearths  
of distant kin.  
In air's tender caress,  
his legacy spins,  
an invisible thread  
binding sky to soil.
